item.title: Blocks your view, 17th September
item.description:
When trying to get out this road to go onto Broxburn your view is restricted be Ayşe cars keep parking on the right and you can’t see if cars are coming. Iv nearly had so many accidents here because the pavement is full of cars and my car is a long wheel base so I have to pull out slightly to try and see if a vehicle is coming. There needs to be yellow lines here or a mirror or something to help us see. Please can you do something about this road. When the pavement is full of cars you really can’t see oncoming traffic it’s a huge hazard!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chanlock Path, South Ockendon
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wood and Toilet Dumped Outside Building, 17th September
item.description:
Firefighters drove past and saw a large amount of domestic wooden waste, including doors and planks of wood, along with a discarded toilet on the entrance to a property. Poses a fire risk.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Manor Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish Dumped & Overflowing Bins, 17th September
item.description:
Firefighters visited a nearby property and conducted a visual inspection of the area. Communal bins are overflowing with cardboard and other combustible waste, including a large sofa.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bethune Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Silver birch needs pruning, 17th September
item.description:
Silver birch on Silvester Road has grown significantly and branches are banging into the neighbouring houses on windy days. It could do with some minor pruning and maintenance
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Silvester Road, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Why didn't they remove it?, 17th September
item.description:
I had previously made a report about a dumped brown food recycling bin outside 57 Weir Hall Road. Earlier today, your men in the van with the cage on the back that you use to collect dumped stuff like this were parked approximately 8 feet from this bin for around 15 minutes.......why didn't they get rid of it? One of them was on the phone loudly for the whole time but the others were not doing anything, why didn't one of them collect it?? I suppose this is why our council tax keeps going up, now you have to come out again tomorrow rather than just clearing the job then! Unbelievable!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weir Hall Avenue, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Slip hazard, 17th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst Road, Petts Wood, London
